      • getBlocksInRadius

        public java.util.List<org.bukkit.block.Block> getBlocksInRadius(org.bukkit.Location centerPoint,
                                                                int xRadius,
                                                                int yRadius,
                                                                int zRadius)
        Gets all blocks in a radius around the fed center location.
        Parameters:
        centerPoint - The location to get all blocks around.
        xRadius - The X radius.
        yRadius - The Y Radius.
        zRadius - The Z Radius.
        Returns:
        A list of all the blocks found.

      • replaceBlocks

        public void replaceBlocks(java.util.List<org.bukkit.block.Block> blocksList,
                          org.bukkit.Material fromMaterial,
                          org.bukkit.Material toMaterial,
                          byte fromData,
                          byte toData)
        Replaces all blocks in the fed list with the specified material and data to the new material and data.
        Parameters:
        blocksList - The list of blocks to replace.
        fromMaterial - The material that a block has in the block list.
        toMaterial - The material that you want the blocks to change to.
        fromData - The data that a block has in the block list.
        toData - The data that you want the blocks to change to.

      • isLocationBetweenTwoLocations

        public boolean isLocationBetweenTwoLocations(org.bukkit.Location location,
                                             org.bukkit.Location point1,
                                             org.bukkit.Location point2)
        Gets if the defined location is between the 2 specified points. It's just like the well-known plugin WorldEdit.
        Parameters:
        location - The location you want to check is between the two locations.
        point1 - The 1st location.
        point2 - The 2nd location.
        Returns:
        Whether the location is in fact between the two locations or not.

        public java.util.List<org.bukkit.block.Block> getBlocksInChunk(org.bukkit.Chunk chunk)
        Gets all the blocks in the specified chunk.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk you want to get all blocks from.
        Returns:
        A list of all the found blocks.

      • getEntitiesInRadius

        public java.util.List<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> getEntitiesInRadius(org.bukkit.Location centerLocation,
                                                                    double distance)
        Gets all entities in a radius around the location within the defined distance.
        Parameters:
        centerLocation - The center location to find entities around.
        distance - The distance from the specified center location.
        Returns:
        A list off all the found entities.

        public XZot1K.plugins.zb.libraries.locationlib.Direction getDirection(float yaw)
        Gets a direction based on the fed yaw value.
        Parameters:
        yaw - The yaw from a location (player or entity to be specific).
        Returns:
        The direction that was found/calculated.

      • getYaw

        public double getYaw(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace blockFace)
        Gets a yaw value based on the block face fed to it.
        Parameters:
        blockFace - The blockface you want to calculate the yaw from.
        Returns:
        The yaw that was calculated from the blockface.
